How to use the package phyViz
========================================================

The very first thing to do is to load the necessary libraries and the example tree datatype (tree.rda). 

```{r}
library(phyViz)
library(plyr)
library(reshape2)
library(ggplot2)
library(stringr)
library(igraph)
load(system.file("doc","example","tree.rda",package="phyViz"))
```

Now that you have loaded the raw tree.rda file, you can observe the first ten lines of it:

```{r}
head(tree)
```

You can convert it to the treeGraph format that will be used in subsequent functions:

#```{r}
#treeGraph = processTreeGraph(tree)
#head(treeGraph)
#```

Convert the data frame object into an object that can be read by igraph package

mygraph = graph.data.frame(treeGraph, directed= T)
